description: Command reference for the Treasure Island text adventure game. Use this to interpret player intent and map natural language to valid game commands.
instructions: When parsing player input, identify the intent and map it to the most appropriate command. Extract any required parameters (like item names or directions). Return the command in the format: 'command parameter' (e.g., 'take letter', 'north', 'kill dracula').

commands.description: Initialize the game engine and load world data. This is called automatically when starting the game.
Start a new game from the beginning, resetting all progress.
Look around the current location to see its description, available exits, and items present.
Move north from the current location if an exit exists in that direction.
Move south from the current location if an exit exists in that direction.
Move east from the current location if an exit exists in that direction.
Move west from the current location if an exit exists in that direction.
Move up (climb stairs, ladder, etc.) if an exit exists in that direction.
Move down (descend stairs, ladder, etc.) if an exit exists in that direction.
Move left relative to the direction the player is facing.
Move right relative to the direction the player is facing.
Move forward in the direction the player is currently facing.
Move backward (opposite to the direction the player is facing).

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: The name of the item to pick up from the current location.

commands.description: Pick up an item from the current location and add it to your inventory.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: The name of the item to drop from your inventory.

commands.description: Drop an item from your inventory at the current location.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: The name of the item to examine.

commands.description: Examine an item closely to get more details about it. Some items reveal secrets or clues when examined.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: The name of the item to purchase.

commands.description: Buy an item from a shop or vendor. Requires being at a location that sells items and having enough money.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: The name of the item to pawn/sell.

commands.description: Sell an item at the pawn shop for money. Must be at the pawn shop location.
Attempt to steal money from the bank. This is risky and may have consequences.
Request a loan from the bank. Requires collateral (TheRepublic book). Must be at the bank.
Use the monkey's paw to make a wish. You only get one wish, so choose wisely. Requires the monkey's paw in inventory. Wishing for 'rescue' will teleport you to safety but you may lose treasures.

parameters.name: slot
parameters.description: The save slot number (1-9). If not specified, uses the next available slot.

commands.description: Save the current game progress to a save slot.

parameters.name: slot
parameters.description: The save slot number to load from.

commands.description: Load a previously saved game from a save slot.

parameters.name: slot
parameters.description: The save slot number to delete.

commands.description: Delete a saved game from a save slot.
Get help or hints about the current location or situation.
Toggle AI-embellished descriptions on or off. When on, location descriptions are enhanced with additional atmospheric details.
Sleep to pass time. Advances the game clock by several hours. Must be in an appropriate location (like a cabin or bedroom).
Rest briefly to pass a small amount of time.
Dig at the current location. Requires a shovel in your inventory. Some locations have buried items or secrets.
Pray at the current location. May have special effects at certain locations like churches.
Have your fortune told. Must be at the fortune teller's location.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: The target to kill (e.g., 'dracula', 'vampire'). Currently only Dracula can be killed.

commands.description: Attack and kill an enemy. To kill Dracula, you need a wooden stake and hammer, must be in the Coffin Room, and it must be daytime (6am-8pm).
Light something on fire. To light coal, you need matches (that aren't wet) and must be in the West Ice Cave. Lighting coal melts the ice.
Swim across water. In the Fissure Room, you can swim across the fissure only after the ice has been melted and the fissure is filled with water.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: What to drink from (defaults to canteen).

commands.description: Drink water from your canteen. Relieves thirst, which is important in the Salt Room where you'll die without water.
Fill a container with water. The canteen can be filled at a creek or in the West Ice Cave after melting ice.
Rub Aladdin's lamp to make a wish. The lamp can only be used once and will teleport you across the fissure. Use it wisely!

Signal for rescue at Rescue Beach. To light a signal fire, you need matches and fuel (driftwood, lumber, or coal). If you've been on the island long enough (30+ days), patrol ships may spot you even without a fire.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: The item to turn on or off (e.g., 'flashlight').

commands.description: Turn an item on or off. Currently supports the flashlight. You need to have the flashlight turned on to see in dark areas like Goblin Valley.

categories.system: Commands for game management (save, load, help)
categories.exploration: Commands for examining the environment and items
categories.inventory: Commands for managing items you carry
categories.commerce: Commands for buying, selling, and financial transactions
categories.action: Commands for performing actions in the game world

parsingGuidelines.itemNameNormalization: Item names should be converted to camelCase without spaces (e.g., 'wooden stake' -> 'woodenStake', 'aladdin's lamp' -> 'aladdinsLamp').

intentExamples.input: give the wallet to the constable

naturalLanguagePatterns.intent: The player wants to move. If it's a direction, use that direction command. If it's a location name, this is not directly supported - suggest using directions instead.
Extract the action from after 'i want to' and map to appropriate command.
Extract the action and map to appropriate command if valid.
